intro: Leucostemma webbianum, commonly known as the mountain leucostema, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and clusters of white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and mountain meadows. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Leucostemma webbianum plays a role in supporting local pollinators and maintaining ecological balance in its habitat.
